page.title: 17WORSHIP APPLETON WISKE
page.content: There is a C.of E. church and two Methodist chapels in the area.St.Marys church in Appleton is the oldest and the remains of scallops and serpents can be seen on the fine 12th century chancel arch. Markings of an incised sun dial can be seen on the outside wall.Today the church has a bell tower and a slate roof. Heating is and costs of repairs to this beautifull building have been high recently.Congregations are small except on special accasions such as Cubs/Scouts paraades. A lych gate is both entrance and village war memorial rev.Geoff Wood of Smeaton vicar.The methodist Chapel on Front Street was built in 1821. Services are held on the 2nd Sunday each month. Mr. Sleightholme takes the Sunday School. The small Methodist chapel at Hornby was rebuilt in 1926. Emma Bell
